instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1932: What is A1932? A1932 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2018, 2019 with EMC 3184, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01521..
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> CD3215A10 from Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hey guys!

I'm struggling to find chips for this <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 820 - 01521 A board such as CD3215A10 and TPS51980A

After looking around I'm feeling like I need donor boards for this model... I can't find stencils for <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> either... 

Can anyone point me in the right direct :) 

Thanks

threads.title: <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> CD3215A10 from Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.aliexpress.com/item/1005002043371316.html?spm=a2g0o.productlist.0.0.647d3dafa0p2pE&algo_pvid=7f028dfd-b0fd-47f5-b5e5-77c9189f0a20&algo_expid=7f028dfd-b0fd-47f5-b5e5-77c9189f0a20-0&btsid=2100bdd816182272777736407ecc18&ws_ab_test=searchweb0_0,searchweb201602_,searchweb201603_[/URL]
I'm sure you can find more sellers.

TPS51980A can be found in many old MacBooks Air/Pro boards.

threads.title: <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> CD3215A10 from Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
Thanks for your reply.

Of course I can find these from Ali, etc, I was hoping for something under certain quality control! 

Thanks for confirming this is the best option though :)

threads.title: <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> CD3215A10 from Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
I already mentioned on the forum.
In my opinion, the best option for <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips, is buying "wing boards" in Aliexpress.
You may expect 10-20% of bad chips, but all are original at least.
